title.narrative: Accountability and safeguarding support for three partners working with indigenous communities

description.narrative: Through this project, CAFOD will support three strategic partners in Bolivia (Fundacion Nuna, CENDA and ACLO Potosi) in developing first drafts of child protection policies including codes of conduct, complaints handling mechanisms and policies covering communications and recruitment. At the end of the training the participants will understand how to undertake their work without putting children at risk, how to recognise signs of abuse; how to manage child protection issues in a sensitive manner and how to manage a case of abuse, a complaint of abuse, suspicions or worries that abuse is occurring. Participants will have better understanding of CAFOD's requirements concerning child protection, CAFOD's own policy and standards and the support that partners can expect from CAFOD. Participants will develop action plans for their institution during the training that set out steps to further develop their institutional policy and engage with communities and other actors.
